intro: Genista stenoptera, commonly known as the narrow-leaved broom, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open woodlands. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in spring, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. The shrub is often used in landscaping for its hardiness and ornamental value.
